page.title: 03KINGSCLERE'S CHURCHES (2)
page.content: The{Methodist church}is also flint- built, and stands in the Square. Services are held on Sunday mornings, and at the same time children of the Sunday-school meet in the School-room. This caters for children of both the Methodist church and St. Mary's. There is also a Women's Fellowship which meets on Wednesdays. The schoolroom is used by other groups in the village as a meeting-place. The{Roman Catholic church}occupies what was once the village hall, although it was privately run. Services are held on Sundays and Thursdays, and the priest comes from the church at Tadley. As well as the church, there is a club where people can buy drinks and play games, and this has become an important social centre for the village.
